IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
*STATE POLICE IMPAIRED DRIVING REDUCTION EFFORT (S.P.I.D.R.E) TEAM*
MVR Statement: The following incident was captured on in-car camera.
Title: RINGGOLD "R" 23-422. ID: 23-MSP-028325
Arrested: Ringgold, Felicia Allenzairra.
Certification and training
     -Trained in Field Sobriety Test through Maryland State Police Academy.
     -Trained in Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement (A.R.I.D.E)
     -Trained and certified to operate RADAR and LIDAR through the Maryland State Police.
    - Graduated from The Institute of Advanced Law Enforcement Studies Driving Under the Influence Institute-University of Maryland.
     - I have apprehended more than 240 impaired drivers during my tenure with the Maryland State Police to date.
VEHICLE IN MOTION (PHASE 1)
          On August 11, 2023, at approximately 0212 hours, I, TFC. I. Riba Tankari # 7058 with Maryland State Police was traveling inner loop I-695 east of Charles Street, Baltimore County, Maryland in lane #2 (middle lane). My issued patrol vehicle is Maryland State Police marked unit DUI-3. At that time, I observed a blue Honda Civic bearing Maryland registration 1FH9927 traveling inner loop I-695 in lane #2 appeared to be traveling over the posted speed limit and was unable to stay within a single lane. I observed the Honda had swerved from lane #2 into lane #1 (left lane) by more than half vehicle width then swerved back into lane #3 (right lane) and continued traveling in lane #3. I followed the Honda and with my properly functioning patrol vehicle Golden Eagle II radar unit set activated, I obtained a speed reading of 83 in a posted 55 MPH zone. I observed the Honda had swerved from lane #3 into the York Road exit lane by more than one tire width and continued traveling partially between the two lanes. I observed the Honda had swerved from lane #3 into lane #2 by half vehicle width then swerved back into lane #3 crossing the solid white into the right shoulder. I continued to follow the Honda and observed the vehicle had swerved from lane #3 into lane #2 by more than half vehicle width on one occasion.
I initiated a traffic stop on the Honda using my emergency equipment. The Honda came to a stop in the area of inner loop I-695 and Dulaney Valley Road, Baltimore County, Maryland on the right shoulder.
PERSONAL CONTACT (PHASE 2)
    I approached the Honda on the driver side and made contact with the driver, a female passenger sleeping in the front passenger seat and another female passenger sleeping in the rear passenger seat of the vehicle. I introduced myself and explained to her the reason for the traffic stop. I asked the driver where she was coming from, and she stated she was coming from her friend's house and was going home. I requested her driver's license and registration card. I detected a strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from the vehicle. The driver was identified through her Maryland driver's license as Ringgold, Felicia Allenzairra.
 I returned to my patrol vehicle and notified the barrack who I was out with. I returned to the Honda and requested Ringgold to exit her vehicle and walk to the front of her vehicle and she complied.
I asked Ringgold how many alcoholic beverages she had consumed, and she stated she had three shots of Hennessy. I asked her around what time, and she stated “I was at Dave and Busters it was probably like twelve, they close at twelve o'clock.” While speaking with Ringgold outside her vehicle, I again detected a strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from her breath and person. I asked Ringgold to submit to Standardized Field Sobriety Tests, and she agreed.
    The evaluation surface was dry, flat, and free of debris. No surface defects were observed. My patrol flashlight her vehicle headlight, and overhead lamps lit the area. My patrol vehicle's forward emergency lights were deactivated during all three tests. Ringgold appeared to be in good physical conditions.
I asked Ringgold the following questions:
Medical conditions: No.
Medications: No.
Anything that will prevent you from walking on straight line or standing on one leg: No
Glasses or contact: wears glasses but not at that moment, she denied wearing contacts.
PRE-ARREST SCREENING (PHASE 3)
HORIZONTAL GAZE NYSTAGMUS: (6/6 clues observed).
The Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus test was explained and administered per the NHTSA SFST Manual.
- Equal pupil size and equal tracking, no resting nystagmus
- Lack of Smooth Pursuit – Present in both eyes
- Distinct and Sustained Nystagmus at Maximum Deviation – Present in both eyes
- Onset of Nystagmus Prior to 45 Degrees – Present in both eyes
Notes:
* During the HGN test, I continued to detect a strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from Ringgold’s breath.
WALK AND TURN: (7/8 clues observed).
The test was properly explained and demonstrated per the NHTSA SFST Manual.
Ringgold stated that she understood the instructions and how the test was to be performed.
Instructional Stage:
Ringgold lost her balance to the right on seven separate occasions.
Walking Stage (1st Nine):
Missed touching heel to toe by more than one inch on counts 2.
Raised her arms for balance more than six (6) inches away from her body on counts 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, and 9.
Stepped completely offline by one shoe width on counts 8
Stopped walking on counts 2 and 4.
Turn:
The turn was not completed correctly; instead Ringgold turned to her right failing to take a series of small steps as instructed and demonstrated.
Walking Stage (2nd Nine):
Missed touching heel to toe by more than half inch on counts 5, 8, and 9.
Raised her arms for balance more than six (6) inches away from her body on all counts.
Stepped completely offline by one shoe width on counts 4 and 6.
Stopped walking on count 6.
Took ten actual steps when instructed to take 9.
One Leg Stand Test (4/4 clues observed)
The test was properly explained and demonstrated per the NHTSA SFST Manual.
Ringgold stated that she understood the instructions and how the test was to be performed.
Left foot raised during the test.
Balance and Count Stage:
Seconds 0-10:
Swayed body to the right and left.
Raised right arm more than six (6) inches from her side for balance.
Left foot hit the ground one time.
Seconds 11-20:
Swayed body to the right and left.           
Raised arms more than six (6) inches from her side for balance.
Left foot hit the ground one time.
Seconds 21-30:
Raised arms more than six (6) inches from her side for balance.
Swayed body to the right and left.
Left foot hit the ground three times.
Hopped.
Preliminary Breath Test:
    I explained and offered a PBT to Ringgold. Ringgold elected to consent to the PBT and results were .13 BAC.
ARREST
   Based on the following, I had reason to believe Ringgold was driving a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol and was unable to operate a motor vehicle safely:
      - Driving over the posted speed limit (83 Mph in 55 Mph speed limit zone)
       -Unable to stay within a single lane/driving patterns. 
       -Strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from vehicle.
       -Strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from her breath as she conversed with me.
       -Her admissions to consuming alcoholic beverages prior to driving.
       -Observed signs of impairment as she performed the Standardized Field Sobriety Tests.
       - Preliminary Breath Test result of .13 BrAC.
      Ringgold was arrested for driving under the influence of alcohol and unable to operate a motor vehicle at 0234 hours and was transported to the Baltimore County Towson Precinct. Upon arrival at Precinct, Ringgold was given a copy of the DR-15 Advice of Rights, and it was read to her from the MVA website in English, and she elected to consent to the Intoximeter EC/IR II test at 0402 hours.
20-MINUTE OBSERVATION PERIOD:
I conducted the 20-minute observation period with Ringgold beginning of her arrest. She remained in my custody from the time of her arrest. While at the precinct, Ringgold requested to use bathroom and I agreed. I restarted another 20 minutes observation at 0350 hours. Nothing was introduced to her mouth at any time. A search revealed that she had nothing in her mouth. The test was conducted by OFC. Holt Intox ID #0590 of the Baltimore County Police Department on a certified instrument and a result of .08 grams of alcohol per 210 liters of breath was obtained at 0418 hours. Ringgold was polite and cooperative during the encounter.
Ringgold was given pertinent paperwork and released from the Precinct to her uncle pending an appearance in the District Court of Maryland for Baltimore County at a later date.
  All events occurred in Baltimore County, Maryland.
  Case closed by arrest.
